text:
Is anyone interested in code golf here? I’m trying to translate this python program into the smallest julia program possible:
```import pandas as pd
df = pd.read_json("<gs://bucket/file.json.gz>", lines=True)```
This is the best that I have:
```;gsutil cp "<gs://bucket/file.json.gz>" .
using DataFrames, CodecZlib, JSON3

df = open("file.json.gz") do file
    DataFrame(JSON3.read(GzipDecompressorStream(file); jsonlines=true); copycols=false)
end```

elements.text: Is anyone interested in code golf here? I’m trying to translate this python program into the smallest julia program possible:

import pandas as pd
df = pd.read_json("gs://bucket/file.json.gz", lines=True)
This is the best that I have:

;gsutil cp "gs://bucket/file.json.gz" .
using DataFrames, CodecZlib, JSON3

df = open("file.json.gz") do file
    DataFrame(JSON3.read(GzipDecompressorStream(file); jsonlines=true); copycols=false)
end

text: I doubt you're going to get it as short as the pandas version, simply because all that fancyness isn't part of DataFrames itself
